channel.title: Ok im releasing this after a long time
channel.description:
Alright i dont know where to post this so im posting it here if you guys dont mind... -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The purpose of this project was to find runescapes source files. not the .java files but the .class files required to physically run the applet that loads runescape.
Sortof like the private servers we run.
Ok heres the story behind this project:
A long time ago when kaitneiks only specialty was scar, i was using an autominer script i had found there i realised that their must be some easier method, than just utilizing macros.
So i decided to look into hacking.
Now i wont lie to you , i was a script kidde back then and i admit it. I knew almost nothing of java, or programming at all. So i looked around for sites that might teach me this i came across hackthissite.org, it was difficult at first but when i got the hang of it, i knew this was for me. (Anyway back to the story) After completing most of the tasks on that site i wanted to see if i could hack runescape, now this was like 5 months after rs2 had been released. and i had no idea about the strength of security around runescape. After viewing the source i realised that the applet gets the code to run the class file from a loader. i found the loader and downloaded it, but again i had no skills in java what so ever so i gave up passed that. Then i came across a book about java , i believe it was called java black book i read it, and i wont lie i barly understood half of it; but it did give me a general understanding of java. Now i tried programing a decompiler to decompile the file but did not succeed. (back then i did not know their where free decompilers i know its sad) Again i gave up. Frustrated by failure i decided to try again, and this time i came across a marvelous little jem called "cavaj" i looked at the source of the class file i had downloaded and found another loader file and a jar file. now i decompiled the loader file and again found another file by the name of runescape.js5 and runescape.pack200 I tried opening them with every method i know, but did not succeed.
I have put all my files in this archive mabye you will succeed in decrypting them.
I have also put a number of other related files in here including several deobs, sorry i dont have the names to give credit. please pm if you want credit. ************************************************************ Remember the purpose of this is to find the server side files, rather the client side ************************************************************ [code] http://rapidshare.de/files/27110741/runescapehackingkitbythefifthlord.rar.html [/code]
the password is : thefifthlord
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ edit:
here are some tools that might help
Runescape Cache Extractor: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,4172.html
Runescape pack200 Extractor: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,5032.html#msg51175

Hmmm… … . .

item.title: Ok im releasing this after a long time
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

thefifthlord:

Well im stuck at the rsa file seems if we can crack that file we can edit packets and reencrypt them as if the client sent them, this would make autoing a piece of cake and it would make it undectable

Not quite how it would work - RSA is just one of the anti-packet spoofing measures they’ve implemented. But if you want to have a go at it, get yourself a good Lenstra factorization program and some time on a fast cluster…got a university nearby?

Exponent:
58778699976184461502525193738213253649000149147835990136706041084440742975821

Modulus:
7162900525229798032761816791230527296329313291232324290237849263501208207972894053929065636522363163621000728841182238772712427862772219676577293600221789

item.source: Ok im releasing this after a long time

item.title: Ok im releasing this after a long time
item.dc:creator: @pimjong pimjong
item.description:
@pimjong wrote:

You cant decompile, but well, you can let it run with bytecode editing.
Sorry, but im bored to write how to do it so ill copy and past RLN’s tutorial, all credits to RLN:

download a working copy of jackie which can be found uploaded here :
http://upit.be/download.php?id=1973

now install that program, get a copy of the current client, can be found here
http://po4.epacsenur.com/epacsenur.jar

now extract the jar and make a batch file in the same folder with these params
Quote:
java client 37 live rc highmem members english
pause

now open client in jackie (right click class and select open with)
click loaded classes
click methods tab
click main
scroll to bottom - look at top of screen
look where it says
Code:
invokestatic java.net.InetAddress java.net.InetAddress.getLocalHost()

change that to
Code:
invokestatic java.net.InetAddress java.net.InetAddress.getByName(java.lang.String)

add this above it
Code:
ldc “po4.epacsenur.com”

click file in the top left corner - save - run and whoa - u can log into rs on a client

  • change epacsenur to runescape

Read full topic

Well, nothing special but, I unpacked the runescape.pack200 with that unpacker thing, and I ran the client with some valid args. ( Runescape.pack200 is just the client, I think. )

This is wierd:
Usage: worldid, [live/office/local], [live/rc/wip], [lowmem/highmem], [free/memb
ers], [english/german]

Stops at connecting to update server though, of course.
I havn’t tryed decompiling any of it yet though -.-
